H0.text: Highly viscous is the viscosity found in long-chain hydrocarbons.

H1.text: Increased viscosity is the kind of viscosity found in long-chain hydrocarbons.

H2.text: Low viscosity is the type of viscosity found in long-chain hydrocarbons.

H3.text: Intense viscosity is the kind of viscosity found in long-chain hydrocarbons.

A4.text: Alkanes from nonane to, for instance, hexadecane (an alkane with sixteen carbon atoms) are liquids of higher viscosity, less and less suitable for use in gasoline.

A5.text: Alkanes with a chain length of approximately 35 or more carbon atoms are found in bitumen, used, for example, in road surfacing.
